items.content_html:
Description

I've gone ahead and added a page to document the SVG shape-subtract attribute.
In doing this I've largely following the example of the text-anchor page, trying to mirror it as closely as possible while reviewing the CONTRIBUTING.md and other relevant docs to ensure it meets the standards of MDN's docs.

The writeup and example portion of this have been taken straight from the specification's text and examples to ensure they are valid and accurate.

A quick warning though, no specification table or compatibility table exists yet for this item. So I will soon be making a companion PR to mdn/browser-compat-data to include this item as needed, to populate the {{Specifications}} and {{Compat}} sections.

(Also this is my first time contributing to an MDN repo, so please let me know if there was something I could've done better)

Motivation

Why: I've been using MDN's resources for years, and after a project I've been working on needed to rely on some of MDN's data I wished more docs had existed for certain items, so I decided to go ahead and do my part to make them exist.

How: Ideally this can better describe the capabilities of SVG and make attributes like this more well known for those that aren't reading through the specs themselves.

Additional details

  • Specification for Attribute
  • Example Docs Used
  • Specification for Example Attribute

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add Docs for SVG `shape-subtract` Attribute

items.content_html:
The documentation refers to the host_permission key in the manifest file, which I believe should be host_permissions.

Description

Fix a name of a manifest.json key that is incorrect in this documentation page (host_permission vs. host_permissions).

Motivation

I was reading the page and noticed it is incorrect, it will help the readers if it is corrected.

Additional details

The documentation of host_permissions on MDN that has the correct field name:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/manifest.json/host_permissions

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix 'host_permissions' manifest key name

items.content_html:
Description

Updated regexp for Processing a text file line by line

Motivation

Updated regexp for Processing a text file line by line using fetch api docs

const re = /\n|\r|\r\n/gm; would match \n or \r first before the actual \r\n returning unnecessary empty string for each such sequence
updating it to const re = /\r\n|\n|\r/gm; solves the issue.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

"Fixes # 24749"
items.title: Updated regexp for Processing a text file line by line Fetch api

items.content_html:
Part of mdn/mdn#280.

This PR adds a guide page to PWA installation. It will replace https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Installing.

Some notes and things.

  • this is supposed to be what Divio calls an "explanation", sort of. So I don't want it to go into how-to territory for things like making a PWA a standalone app - in fact, it would probably be good for some of these sections to link to relevant How-to guides. I think this page is about orientation and explaining what sorts of things are possible with PWAs, rather than exactly how to do them. This separation of concerns makes it easier for users who have been through the learning process to find the "how to" later on, when they need it for their project.
  • I've used "platform-specific" rather than "native" here, per discussions.
  • I haven't gone a lot into what happens on different platforms, beyond noting what's possible at all on different platforms. Perhaps I could go more into this? In particular, for example, Safari's behavior is quite different. Not sure.
  • likewise I haven't included a lot of screenshots - the old guide had a lot of screenshots from different platforms. I think these usually rot pretty quickly.
  • although the sidebar PR had these under a "main features of PWAs" heading, I've just added this directly under "Guides". This is simpler because we don't need a interstitial "Main features of PWAs" page to list these particular guides. But if we decide to do that we can always move it of course. See how it feels when we have more of them.
  • It would be nice to know more about Firefox behavior and requirements here. I will see if I can add that.

@captainbrosset , @estelle .
items.title: [PWA] Installation guide

items.content_html: This is the 3rd in the series. Revamped based on SC call feedback.

items.content_html:
background:
Currently the "lock PRs" workflow is running daily at 49 11,23 * * *

This causes year-old PRs to be bumped as 'updated recently' every day.

This PR changes the schedule to run at 9am on the first day of the month (0 9 1 * *)

cc @OnkarRuikar:

can we defer locking conversations to weekends or month ends?
Every day the bot puts year old PRs at the top of the merged PRs list. It becomes hard to figure out what got merged yesterday or recently.
items.title: chore(CI): limit locking of old PRs to run only on first day of the month

items.content_html:

This just adds a release note.

Other docs work can be tracked in #24402
items.title: FF111 Relnote: Implement worker modules

items.content_html:
Description

This PR is an almost complete rewrite of the storage quota and eviction page (current version).

The current page has a number of problems listed in issue #23557.
As a summary:

  • it is very Firefox-specific,
  • it contains outdated information,
  • it's nested under the IndexedDB docs while it applies to more than just IDB.

Motivation

I find that web developers do not trust browsers with their data very easily. Data storage management in browsers has evolved quite a lot over the years, and keeps evolving all the time. It is getting easier to build a storage-heavy app these days.

Unfortunately, the documentation out there on the web isn't doing a great job at reassuring people, and a lot of native vs. web decisions are influence by this particular point.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #23557.
items.title: Revamp the storage quota and eviction documentation

items.content_html:
CSS color functions enabled behind a pref (layout.css.more_color_4.enabled) in Fx 111

Additions:

  • color() includes @media query to detect color-gamut support.
  • Examples added for lab(), lch(), oklab(), oklch()
  • Explained ranges for values in color functional notation

Other:

  • Changed use of https://bugzil.la/<number>) to {{bug(<number>)}}

Related issues and pull requests:

  • Parent issue #24395
  • BCD mdn/browser-compat-data#19035

Bugzilla:

  • color() https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1128204
  • lab(), lch(), oklab(), oklch() https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1352757

TODO:

  • The bug macro is deprecated, revert changes in this PR that touch this
items.title: relnote(Fx111): color(), lab(), lch(), oklab(), oklch() support

items.content_html:
Description

Update the heading of the section to better reflect the content of the paragraph.

Motivation

Update the heading of the section to better reflect the content of the paragraph, which emphasizes the importance of standardization and implementation in MDN Web Docs. "Standardization" is a more appropriate term to describe the content of the paragraph, which focuses on documenting web technologies that are on a standards track and implemented by at least one rendering engine. However, "Standardization" may not be the best choice for a heading, and other suggestions are welcome. While "Open web topics" is a broad term that may encompass a range of topics, it is not specific enough to capture the focus of the paragraph.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update heading from "Open web topics" to "Standardization"
